attributes.action: take immediate action to reverse the Government's housing policy which will destroy the greenbelt of Southern England, for example the plans to develop 800 acres of the Parishes of Caddington and Slip End in Bedfordshire.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the Government’s housing policy, in Southern England, Bushwood Green development has proposed to concrete over the 800 acres of natural fields and woodland adjacent to the South Bedfordshire villages of Caddington and Slip End, previously classified as an area of outstanding natural beauty, and create an urban sprawl.

The development will destroy the greenbelt, cause chaos in the nearby towns and villages and create nightmare congestion as gridlocked roads will be unable to support the influx of additional traffic.

Further, this development will set a dangerous precedent allowing other developers to move in and wreck the local countryside environment without any concern for other greenbelt areas.

We ask the Prime Minister to take immediate action to reverse the Government's policy and stop the proposed Bushwood Green development which will otherwise destroy the 800 acres of the Parishes of Caddington and Slip End in Bedfordshire.

rejection.details: Please provide the name of the person petitioning, and then the organisation name under the field marked 'organisation'.
reasons: False or incomplete name or address information
